name: SupportCormagAndTana
_source: speak;Cormag;Princess Tana!|That still sounds so odd to me.|You know, I had no idea you were a princess at first.|But please, just call me Cormag.|There's no need for honorifics with me.
speak;Tana;Cormag it is, then.|I had a favor to ask of you.
speak;Cormag;What would you have me do, Princess?
speak;Tana;I'm prone to attacks from archers when I'm on the battlefield...
speak;Cormag;That makes two of us.|It's a common problem for airborne soldiers.
speak;Tana;I thought perhaps we could keep watch for archers and warn one another.
speak;Cormag;Hm.|Yes, you've got a good idea there.|A “buddy system” of sorts.|But if you saw an ally in danger, you'd warn him regardless, wouldn't you?

speak;Tana;Well, of course!|But we're so high up that I was worried...|If I saw an archer, I didn't think my voice would carry to you in time.|Perhaps the neighing of a pegasus or the cries of a wyvern could carry far enough to warn the others.

speak;Cormag;Oh!|I see...|Yes, we might not be able to hear each other in the heat of battle.|But our steeds can be louder than either of us could.|And trust me, my wyvern's shriek can pierce your ear from two leagues away.|A brilliant idea, Your Highness.
speak;Cormag;Right, so if we see anything out there, we'll have our mounts call out, right?
speak;Tana;Cormag, thanks for warning me about that archer the other day.|Your wyvern startled me, but I think you may have saved my life!
speak;Cormag;Well, you should thank him, then.|I can't take credit for it.|I mean, he started shrieking out to you before I even saw that bowman.
speak;Cormag;The bond between a wyvern and rider is close, and this guy's a smart one.|I'm sure you and your pegasus are the same, wouldn't you say?

speak;Tana;Oh, yes.|It's the same with every knight and her pegasus.|It's so sad to see how war has changed the way we relate to our animal allies.|It's taking such a tremendous toll on these beautiful creatures.
speak;Cormag;I agree.|This whole war is ludicrous.|War itself is madness, even more so if it's for greed or the fantasy of power.
speak;Tana;I hope our efforts end this war quickly.|I don't want to see anyone else die.
speak;Cormag;Nor do I.|But you cannot race headlong into battle.|We'll need you to help rebuild our shattered nations, after all.|We soldiers are expendable, but you regal types aren't.
speak;Tana;Don't throw your life away.|Promise me, will you?
speak;Cormag;As you wish, Princess.|I'll be careful.
speak;Tana;What are you fighting for, Cormag?
speak;Tana;I saw you fighting earlier...|and for some reason, it made me sad.
speak;Cormag;I see.|I can think of many reasons why a man would fight.|Atonement, revenge, entertainment...|For power...|For fun...|But I don't know the reason I am fighting anymore.
speak;Cormag;What more would you expect from a man who's lost his faith?|A man whose emperor has gone mad, whose homeland is collapsing?
speak;Tana;What are you going to do when the war is over?
speak;Cormag;I'll help rebuild Grado, of course, but I'm not sure beyond that.|I doubt that I'll remain in Grado for long, though.|They've branded me a traitor.|I'll find no home awaiting me there.
speak;Tana;Then why don't you come to Frelia?|You can join us as an airborne knight!
speak;Cormag;And what makes you think a traitor like me would be welcomed in Frelia?

speak;Tana;You're no traitor, Cormag.|You've stayed true to your beliefs.|That sadness I saw in you comes from your own country's betrayal of those beliefs.|Your sadness runs as deep as your faith in Grado once ran.|I want your faith, your strength, and your passion to serve Frelia now.
speak;Cormag;I appreciate the offer, but I cannot reforge the oaths I've broken.|I'm sorry.
speak;Tana;It's all right.|I understand your feelings.|However, if you ever wish to serve your beliefs again, remember my offer.
speak;Cormag;I might just give up this soldiering nonsense and go into woodworking.
speak;Tana;Then I'll track you down in your woodshop and ask again.
speak;Cormag;You may not look it, but you're pretty strong willed for a princess.|I'll think about your offer.
